attributes.action: Restore the balance between traffic and people by making 20mph the default speed limit in towns to remove traffic threats to pedestrians and cyclists, children and the elderly.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: A 20mph speed default speed limit in towns would improve safety, quality of life, urban environment and health by encouraging more active travel, particularly by children.  It would make town streets less treatening to vulnerable pedestrians and improve community. It would help counter obesity, reduce carbon emissions and improve our record of pedestrian casualties by encouraging less car use for short journeys including the school run.
